content: You are correct that the words "one" and "two" are not technically homophones, as they are pronounced differently. Homophones are words that are pronounced the same but have different meanings, such as "blew" and "blue" or "knight" and "night." In the sentence "One One was a race horse Two Two was one too," the words "one" and "too" are homophones, as they are pronounced the same but have different meanings. My previous response was incorrect, and I apologize for the mistake. Thank you for bringing it to my attention.
